text: technology can turn day into night and
modern cities pulse with energy and come
alive after dark bright lights are part
of any city today but nighttime during
the age of dinosaurs was a very
different experience
the moon did not always shine and night
could create a place of almost
impenetrable darkness in the blackness
of night sound was often the only guide
the key for survival was the capacity to
hear the faintest sounds the ability to
move and hunt at night
protected mammals like Leila STIs from
predators they're nocturnal abilities
also enabled our ancestors to find and
feed on insects
scientists believe that from the time
mammals began nocturnal activities their
brains had started to evolve differently
from those of dinosaurs hunting in the
dark refined those sensory skills
necessary to find food lay less T's and
its powerful sense of hearing led to
further development of the inner body
the ability to detect different sounds
brought into play well-developed ear
structures as a sound vibrates the
eardrum it goes through the malleus and
incus and into the brain
the importance of senses like hearing
was essential in mammalian development
brain power was a key to their survival
